intro: Aneilema clandestinum, commonly known as the ghost plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, pale green leaves that give it a ghostly appearance, hence its common name. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Aneilema clandestinum is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories.
